message.content: This question requires some basic knowledge about the properties of quartz. Quartz is a very hard and durable mineral, ranking a 7 on the Mohs scale of mineral hardness. It is harder than smelted silica, which is made by heating and melting quartz. Therefore, quartz can easily damage smelted silica. Options (B), (C), and (D) are incorrect because quartz is not harder than granite, diamonds, or steel.

This question involves knowledge about the properties of quartz and its ability to damage certain materials. Quartz is a hard mineral and can easily scratch or damage smelted silica, which is a type of glass made from silica. Option (B) is incorrect because granite is a harder material than quartz and cannot easily be damaged by it. Option (C) is incorrect because diamonds are the hardest material and cannot be damaged by quartz. Option (D) is incorrect because steel is also a harder material than quartz and cannot be easily damaged by it.
